Hey, Xperience developers! Whether you’re completely new to Xperience by Kentico or looking for some additional guidance, we’ve got you covered. We’ve just released some new training materials to help you get started quickly and smoothly 🚀.
## Developer kickstart series
Build your first Xperience website with our updated **[Developer kickstart](https://docs.kentico.com/tutorial/developer-tutorial)** (formerly Developer tutorial). We know starting with a new platform can feel overwhelming, so we’ve stripped away advanced functionality to give you a **simplified overview** of the Xperience development process. The series focuses on practical steps. You'll learn how to set up your environment, create data-driven pages, display content, implement simple navigation, and enable dynamic content editing with the Page Builder feature.
This series, paired with our new **Kickstart** repository (available on [GitHub](https://github.com/Kentico/xperience-by-kentico-kickstart/)), is your go-to resource if you’re looking for a straightforward, hands-on introduction to Xperience before exploring our [Training guides](https://docs.kentico.com/guides).
## Developer learning map
Not sure what to learn next? Check out our **[Developer learning map](https://docs.kentico.com/guides/development/developer-learning-map)** - your ultimate guide to navigating all our learning materials and resources for Xperience by Kentico. It’s designed to show you exactly what you need to know in a clear, step-by-step format. Plus, you can check out an interactive version on [roadmap.sh](https://roadmap.sh/r?id=66bdc03491320df4bddcabc8).
## Ready to Jump In?
These resources are here to make your learning Xperience easier 🙂. Try them out and let us know what you think!
